text: The 1966–67 FIBA FIBA European Champions Cup was the tenth season of the European top-tier level professional basketball club competition FIBA European Champions Cup (now called EuroLeague). The trophy was won by Real Madrid, for the third time, at their home venue Pavilion at the Sports City of Real Madrid, after they defeated Simmenthal Milano 91–83.Euroleague final back in Madrid after 41 years ==Competition system== 25 teams. European national domestic league champions, plus the then current FIBA European Champions Cup title holders only, playing in a tournament system. The competition culminated in a Final Four. ==First round== |} *Collegians from Belfast withdrew before the first leg and Herly Amsterdam received a forfeit (2-0) in both games. ==Second round== |} *Hapoel Tel Aviv withdrew before the first leg and Lokomotiv Sofia received a forfeit (2-0) in both games. **After a 142 aggregate drew, a third decisive game was held in which Slavia VŠ Praha won 77–61. ==Quarterfinals group stage== The quarterfinals were played with a round-robin system, in which every Two Game series (TGS) constituted as one game for the record. {| class="wikitable" |+ Key to colors |- | style="background:#cfc;"| |Top two places in each group advance to Semifinals |} {| |- | style="vertical-align:top;
